text: (1) The following significant changes were made during this IRM update:
IRM Description Reference
Added the command code used to update and correct records.
Clarified that Appeals employees cannot correct Exam fields on the AIMS data base.
Added the error messages displayed when attempting to make a correction that is not allowed.
Updated the section explaining the impact of closed records.
Included the programming change that blocks a record from being corrected if it was closed in a prior fiscal year.
Removed reference to Form
as it is no longer used to update the Employee Group Code.
Revised to include information on CC AMREQ ing a TC
Added examples on updating the AIMS Activity Code and information on the programming change which allows the Activity Code to be updated back to the opening Activity Code.
Revised to exclude managerial approval on updates that are done through the unattended automated systems such as CEAS.
Added information on updating/correcting the Survey Reason Code.
Appeals, Large Business and International (LB&I), Small Business and Self-Employed (SB/SE), and Wage and Investment (W&I) employees using AIMS.
EFFECTIVE DATE
Signed by Charlestine Hardy Director, Examination Planning & Delivery; SE:S:E:EPD Small Business/Self-Employed

) In order to allow the official systems of records (AIMS) to be as accurate as possible, there is an extension of the correction capability for two additional to Records reporting cycles (October and November) after the close of the fiscal year. in a Prior Fiscal During this time period, records that failed the computer validity and consis- tency checks which appear on the Accomplishment Error Registers and records entered incorrectly can be corrected. , AIMS Open Control Number is auto populated if a return is on the requisition. Centralized Files and Scheduling files returns by the Open Control Number. If Item

is input on a skeletal record, the input will be overlaid with the AIMS Open Control Number when the full received if a return was requested. After the return is assigned to the field, AIMS Open Control Number is no longer useful and the field can be used enter other information but it must be numerics. (

) The activity code is based on the return as filed without considering any changes made by IRS. This is why the activity code must not be updated the exception of Substitute for Returns, Non-Master File accounts and Retention Register accounts. (cid:
) See IRM Exhibit
, Reference Guide, for a list of Activity Codes (cid:
) See IRM Exhibit
, Form Number, Master File and Non-Master Tax Codes Valid on AIMS, for a list of Activity Codes and the MFT codes (
) The activity code used when a substitute for return was established on ERCS must be updated before the case leaves the group. (cid:
) If a delinquent return is secured, update the activity code on upon receipt of the return, using the figures on the delinquent return. (cid:
) If a delinquent return is not secured, update the activity code using the amounts on the RAR before the case leaves the group. (
) If the estimated activity code of a Non-Master File requisitioned return is wrong, it must be corrected.
The activity code used when a substitute for return was established on AIMS/ ERCS must be updated before the case leaves the group.
(cid:
) If a delinquent return is secured, update the activity code on AIMS/ERCS upon receipt of the return, using the figures on the delinquent return. (cid:
) If a delinquent return is not secured, update the activity code using the amounts on the RAR before the case leaves the group.

(cid:129) If a delinquent return is secured, update the activity code on AIMS/ERCS upon receipt of the return, using the figures on the delinquent return. (cid:129) If a delinquent return is not secured, update the activity code using the amounts on the RAR before the case leaves the group.
AIMS Procedures and Processing
(3) CC AMAXUE - if claim amount is entered, the claim date will be generated if not present on AIMS. If claim amount is deleted the claim date will also be
If it is identified that the Examiner’s time on a case that was closed is incorrect, but the case is now back in inventory, (AMSTUR/AMSTUB) the Ex

aminer’s time cannot be corrected until the case is reclosed. The case must close with an amount equal to or greater than the original closing. Time cannot be corrected if the reopening was after the end of the extended fiscal year as the time input was extracted for the prior fiscal year tables. If it is determined that all the time on the case is Revenue Base Protection (claim for refund) time and the Examiner’s time must be zero, using CC

” are not closed. c. To ensure all procedural requirements are met for cases in special exami- nation programs or projects.
) When a TC
skeletal record contains a freeze code, the code will be printed on the Form
, Examination Charge-Out when the Form
is generated which will not happen until a TC
posts. (
) Only one freeze code can be on a module at a time with exception of the U freeze. The following order of priority: Q, N, P, O, H, M, Z,

) The forms will be placed in an open suspense file, in alphabetical order by freeze code. However, if the areas have defined specialized freeze codes which eliminate the need for the AMFRZ Suspense File, the maintenance of the file is not required.
Only one freeze code can be on a module at a time with exception of the U freeze. The following order of priority: Q, N, P, O, H, M, Z, 1-9.
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions
) Form
(AMFRZR) received from the terminal function will be used to purge and close the open suspense file. Staple the open Form
(AMFRZS) to the Form
(AMFRZR) and place them into a closed file. If the freeze release is approved telephonically, annotate the name of the approving manager and the date the freeze was released on the Form
and place it in the closed file. (
) If the campus input the freeze code, there will be no open Form
(AMFRZS) in the area office suspense file. Note on the Form
reason for no open Form
(i.e. campus input freeze code) and place in closed file. (
) The closed file will be maintained in alphabetical order or by purge date. (
) The closed file will be purged monthly and Forms
that are
days Closed File or older determined from the date of input of AMFRZR will be destroyed in cordance with IRM Exhibit
, Records Control Schedule for Tax Administration – Examination. (

) Command Code AMREQ is used to correct AIMS when update information not been received from Master File. This command code generates a File Information Upon receipt of the TC

, BMF and IMF will send an AIMS update record which will correct the AIMS base. The correction should be reflected within to three weeks from input date. Following are some examples of why CC AMREQ is used: a. Master File reflects a TC
but the TC
has not been reversed on AIMS. b. Master File reflects that the amended return has been released but still has the TC
X freeze. c. Taxpayer name or address at Master File does not match AIMS record. (

Command Code AMREQ is used to correct AIMS when update information has not been received from Master File. This command code generates a TC
Upon receipt of the TC

, BMF and IMF will send an AIMS update record which will correct the AIMS base. The correction should be reflected within two to three weeks from input date. Following are some examples of why CC AMREQ is used:
) Generally, unless the source code used on the original opening was in error, the source code should not be changed unless it meets one of the situations stated in this section. (

) Source codes should reflect the reason the return was examined. Therefore if a return was waiting to be examined in one source code, but actually examined for a different reason, the source code should be updated.
Example: The return was on AIMS in a DIF Source Code 02; but it was examined as part of the Compliance Initiative Program. The source code should be updated to 62.
(1) All Area Office Source Codes are Valid with EGC 54XX or 58XX cases. It is not necessary to change the source code when sending cases to the ESU.

), that does match the current AIMS statute date, an update to the ASED is sent to Date File. Sometimes a TC

) If the TC

will post but will not update the ASED (
) If an alpha code is applicable, it can be entered by itself in the MM space the input screen. This will update the DD portion of the statute date. (

) The Statute Consent Code should be input if a restricted statute extension been secured. An “R” sets the restricted consent indicator. It will be Consent Code on AMDIS immediately after the ASED date. The input of a “U” unsets the stricted consent indicator. The ASED must be input along with the consent code when setting or removing the code. The consent code is valid with all alpha codes except “EE” (
) The Survey Reason Code can be removed on an open record by inputting AMAXUE with a blank in Item
Reason Code (

done through unattended automated systems such as CEAS.
If an alpha code is applicable, it can be entered by itself in the MM space on the input screen. This will update the DD portion of the statute date.

The Statute Consent Code should be input if a restricted statute extension been secured. An “R” sets the restricted consent indicator. It will be displayed on AMDIS immediately after the ASED date. The input of a “U” unsets the re- stricted consent indicator. The ASED must be input along with the consent code when setting or removing the code. The consent code is valid with all alpha codes except “EE”
4.4.34.4.21 (03-04-2011) Verified Assessment Code

The Verified Assessment Code can be input using CC AMAXUE, Item 90. If input it must be the only item number on the screen or the following error message will be displayed “ONLY ITEM 90 MAY BE ENTERED.”
